decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively build a strong board presence using efficient creatures like Scavenging Ooze, Questing Beast, Rimrock Knight, and Brushfire Elemental. These creatures are supported by powerful synergies such as Lovestruck Beast and Edgewall Innkeeper, allowing for consistent card advantage and large swings in tempo. The deck also includes powerful finishers like The Great Henge and Embercleave to further enhance its aggressive strategy. The mana base is designed for consistency and includes a mix of Mountains, Fabled Passage, Cragcrown Pathway, and Forests.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through card draw spells and utility lands. The win condition revolves around casting Shark Typhoon to create flying shark tokens or using Ashiok, Nightmare Muse to generate value and win the game through attrition. The deck's mana base is designed to consistently hit its color requirements and curve out efficiently.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with a combination of evasive creatures, disruptive spells, and powerful card draw. Utilizing the graveyard as a resource, it aims to pressure the opponent with early threats like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief, while controlling the board with removal spells like Eliminate and Drown in the Loch. The inclusion of Zareth San, the Trickster adds versatility and finishing power. By efficiently managing resources and applying constant pressure, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through tempo advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast, aggressive creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge to further boost the power of the creatures and provide additional threats. The deck includes some removal spells like Fire Prophecy and Shatterskull Smashing to deal with opposing threats. Vivien, Monsters' Advocate provides card advantage and additional creature support. The mana base includes Evolving Wilds and Fabled Passage to help fix mana and ensure smooth card draw.

This deck focuses on utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to generate value through flickering multiple permanents. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, enchantments, and creatures like Archon of Sun's Grace to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By constantly flickering permanents with Yorion, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain board control until it can eventually overwhelm them with its powerful threats and inevitability.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by quickly dropping creatures with powerful abilities and utilizing combat tricks and direct damage spells to maintain pressure on the opponent. The main strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Brushfire Elemental, while also using cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge to close out games quickly. The deck also includes removal spells like Fire Prophecy and The Akroan War to deal with opposing threats, ensuring the path is clear for the aggressive creatures to attack and secure victory.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Questing Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Brushfire Elemental to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck also includes powerful cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge to increase the damage output of the creatures. The inclusion of cards like Scavenging Ooze and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate provide additional value and card advantage. With a balanced mix of creatures, spells, and lands, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive playstyle and efficient card choices.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing powerful creatures like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Eliminate and Bonecrusher Giant to control the board and clear a path for the aggressive creatures. The use of cards like Tymaret Calls the Dead and Ox of Agonas allows for card advantage and graveyard recursion, ensuring that the pressure on the opponent is maintained throughout the game. Additionally, the deck includes land cards like Savai Triome and Fabled Passage to provide consistent mana sources for the deck's powerful spells.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy with a mix of creatures and spells. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with evasive threats. Gadwick, Zareth San, and Brazen Borrower provide card advantage and tempo advantage, while Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief attack the opponent's hand and graveyard. Removal spells like Heartless Act and Eliminate help maintain board control, while card draw spells like Into the Story and Drown in the Loch keep the deck's gas flowing. The deck also has a disruptive element with counterspells and a bit of graveyard hate.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent with a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and enchantments. The key strategy involves using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to blink permanents for extra value and card advantage. By utilizing a variety of removal options and powerful enchantments like Doom Foretold and Elspeth Conquers Death, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage over time. The goal is to stabilize the board and eventually win through powerful threats like Dream Trawler and Shark Typhoon.

This Esper Control deck focuses on utilizing a wide range of removal spells, enchantments, and powerful creatures to control the board and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing cards like Doom Foretold, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Dance of the Manse, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board control. With Yorion, Sky Nomad as the companion, the deck also looks to generate additional value through blinking effects and card advantage. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to grind out incremental advantages and emerge victorious through careful resource management and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on a combination of sacrificing creatures, stealing opponents' creatures, and generating card advantage to control the game. It utilizes powerful creatures like Korvold, Fae-Cursed King and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to provide threats while also sacrificing creatures like Woe Strider and Mire Triton for value. Claim the Firstborn and Village Rites are key cards for stealing and sacrificing creatures, while Tymaret Calls the Dead provides card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while steadily building its own board presence and card advantage to ultimately take control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting opponent's plays with counterspells like Jwari Disruption and removal spells like Fire Prophecy, while ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Migration Path to cast powerful spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Genesis Ultimatum. The deck aims to stall the game out until it can overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Shark Typhoon and Beanstalk Giant, while also utilizing the powerful land base and resources to maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by playing powerful creatures and spells to dominate the board. It utilizes cards like Terror of the Peaks and Beanstalk Giant to deal damage to the opponent while maintaining board presence with cards like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant. The deck aims to ramp up its mana with cards like Cultivate and Genesis Ultimatum to cast big threats like The Great Henge and Obosh, the Preypiercer. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through sheer card advantage and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand through counterspells, removal spells, and graveyard hate. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while filling up its own graveyard to fuel cards like Drown in the Loch and Lullmage's Domination. The deck's win condition revolves around milling the opponent with Ruin Crab, Thieves' Guild Enforcer, and Soaring Thought-Thief, and capitalizing on their graveyard strategy with cards like Cling to Dust and Agadeem's Awakening. The deck also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for additional value and recursion.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant board presence with high-impact threats like Dream Trawler and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck utilizes a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw engines to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the battlefield. Overall, the strategy revolves around slowly grinding out a win by outmaneuvering the opponent and utilizing powerful late-game threats to secure victory.
